text: The Yarmouth Clam Festival is a yearly event in Yarmouth, Maine. It started in 1965 to raise money for around forty local non-profit organizations, churches, and school groups. The event lasts three days. It is held the third weekend in July. Yarmouth has around 9,000 people. During the Festival the town has about 120,000 people visit over the course of the weekend. No festival has been held since 2020 on grounds of COVID-19 pandemic. ==References== Category:Festivals in the United States Category:Maine Category:1965 establishments in the United States Category:20th-century establishments in Maine Category:July events
title: Yarmouth Clam Festival
